Posts.Content: May 25, 2011 10:14PM ewa-swimmer wrote: 13/21 A couple of little blisters but saw the RO today and he said my skin was holding up very well. I get bouts of fatigue but nothing that stays around. Finish with the regular treatments on Friday then it's 6 boosts. They remarked me yesterday for the boosts. Told me not to swim, they didn't want the marks to come off. I said sorry, I fell for that at the start, just give me more tape circles and I will replace them if they fall off. I know from long distance swim races that you have to use soap and scratch at the numbers they write on your arms to get it off. Swam this morning and what do you know...I still have the tapes on.

Posts.Content: May 15, 2011 09:43PM ewa-swimmer wrote: I am so used to feeling slimy now from lubing the boob with aloe gel that Tom's doesn't seem that bad. You can let the Tom's dry a bit and then put cornstarch on over it. I got the tip from this forum of putting the cornstarch in a nylon knee high and then just tapping it on. That seems to work. Be careful with organic deodorants because some of them have aluminum in them. That is bad.

Posts.Content: May 18, 2011 11:34PM ewa-swimmer wrote: Ftblmom: the position is part of the accelerated treatment. Not sure who is eligible and who is not. I know that not all clinics have the equipment. Relatively new procedure in U.S. But Canada has a decade of evidence that says it's as effective as the longer treatment at lower dosage.
